Qui-Gon Jinn.description: a Jedi Master who discovers Anakin and insists that the boy be trained as a Jedi, despite the Jedi Council's refusal to do so. Lucas originally wanted to cast an American actor in the role, but cast Neeson (who is Northern Irish) because he considered that Neeson had great skills and presence. Lucas said Neeson was a "master actor, who the other actors will look up to, who has got the qualities of strength that the character demands".[4]
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

Obi-Wan Kenobi.description: Luke's deceased mentor, who guides him to Yoda.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Queen Padmé Amidala.description: the fourteen-year-old Queen of Naboo, who hopes to protect her planet from a blockade invasion made by the Trade Federation. Over 200 actresses auditioned for the role.[6] The Production notes stated; "The role required a young woman who could be believable as the ruler of that planet, but at the same time be vulnerable and open". Portman was chosen especially for her performances in Léon: The Professional (1994) and Beautiful Girls (1996), which impressed Lucas.[4] He stated, "I was looking for someone who was young, strong, along the lines of Leia [and] Natalie embodied all those traits and more".[4] Portman was unfamiliar with Star Wars before being cast,[4] but was enthusiastic about being cast as a character she expected to become a role model. Portman said, "It was wonderful playing a young queen with so much power. I think it will be good for young women to see a strong woman of action who is also smart and a leader."[7]
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

Anakin Skywalker.description: Obi-Wan's gifted Padawan apprentice. He is believed to be the "chosen one" of Jedi prophecy destined "to bring balance to the Force." In the 10 years since The Phantom Menace, he has grown powerful but arrogant, and believes that Obi-Wan is holding him back.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Senator Palpatine / Darth Sidious.description: a Senator of Naboo who is eventually elected as Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic. McDiarmid was surprised when Lucas approached him sixteen years after Return of the Jedi to reprise the role of Palpatine because he had assumed that a younger actor would play the role in the prequel films.[9]
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

C-3PO.description: nthony Daniels as C-3PO, a humanoid protocol droid in the service of Leia Organa.[11]
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

R2-D2.description: An astromech droid, friend of Luke, and longtime companion of C-3PO. He also portrays a GONK power droid in the background.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith
Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Yoda.description: rank Oz as Yoda, the deceased former Grand Master of the Jedi, and Luke's wise former mentor, who appears as a Force-ghost.[22]
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Jar Jar Binks.description: a clumsy Gungan exiled from his home and taken in by Qui-Gon and Obi-Wan. Best was hired after casting director Robin Gurland saw him on a Stomp performance in San Francisco.[8] Best was originally intended to provide motion capture data but his offer to voice the character was accepted. On the set, to provide references for the actors, Best was clothed in a suit made of foam and latex and a headpiece. Best's filmed performance was later replaced with the computer-generated character.[12] Best frequently improvised movements to make Jar Jar look as clumsy and comedic as possible.[8]
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Captain Panaka.description: Queen Amidala's Chief of Security at Theed Palace.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

Mace Windu.description: a Jedi master and senior member of the Jedi Council
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Supreme Chancellor Finis Valorum.description: the Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic who commissions Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon to negotiate with the Trade Federation Viceroy. Lucas described the character as a "good man but he's beleaguered—a bit like [Bill] Clinton"
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

Darth Maul.description: Sith apprentice who uses a double-bladed lightsaber, while Peter Serafinowicz provides Maul's voice.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

Sabé.description: one of Queen Amidala's handmaidens who serves as her decoy throughout the majority of the film.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace

Nute Gunray.description: Gunray is the Viceroy of the Trade Federation, who attempts to assassinate Padmé as revenge for his loss against her people on Naboo. Ki-Adi-Mundi is a Jedi Master and a member of the Jedi Council.
movies: Star Wars: Episode I – The Phantom Menace
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Senator Padmé Amidala.description: Former Queen of Naboo, who has recently been elected the planet's Senator.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Chancellor Palpatine.description: A former Galactic Senator from Naboo, who amasses vast emergency powers upon the outbreak of the Clone Wars.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Count Dooku/Darth Tyranus.description: A former Jedi Master who is now leader of the Separatist movement as Darth Tyranus, and a suspect in Obi-Wan's investigation.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Jango Fett.description: A bounty hunter who gave his DNA for use by the cloning facilities on Kamino for the creation of the clone army. In addition to his wage, he requested an unaltered clone for himself to take as his son – Boba Fett.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Boba Fett.description: A bounty hunter, hired by the Galactic Empire. Jason Wingreen provided Fett's voice in the film's original theatrical cut and the 1997 Special Edition. In the 2004 and 2011 special editions, Temuera Morrison, who played Jango Fett in Attack of the Clones and all his clones, replaced Wingreen as Fett's voice. Bulloch also makes a cameo appearance as the Imperial officer who grabs Leia when she tells Luke to avoid Vader's trap with John Morton doubling as Fett in this scene.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Zam Wesell.description: A bounty hunter and partner of Jango Fett, who is given the task of assassinating Padmé. Although her appearance is human, she is actually a shapeshifter.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Delegate Jar Jar Binks.description: A Gungan whom Padmé appoints Representative of Naboo.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones
Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Watto.description: Anakin's former slave owner on Tatooine.
movies: Star Wars: Episode II – Attack of the Clones

Padmé Amidala.description: a senator of Naboo who is secretly Anakin Skywalker's wife
movies: Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Anakin Skywalker / Darth Vader.description: a Jedi Knight and hero of the Clone Wars who turns to the dark side of the Force and becomes the Sith lord Darth Vader
movies: Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Chancellor Palpatine / Darth Sidious.description: the Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic who is secretly a Sith Lord, and the founder, commander and leader of the Galactic Empire
movies: Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Count Dooku / Darth Tyranus.description: Darth Sidious' Sith apprentice, who was selected by his master to lead the Separatists
movies: Star Wars: Episode III – Revenge of the Sith

Luke Skywalker.description:
a powerful Jedi Master who has been in self-imposed exile on the planet Ahch-To.[10][11]
Hamill voices Dobbu Scay, named after the film's editor, Bob Ducsay. On Canto Bight, the character mistakes BB-8 for a slot machine.[12][13][14]

Princess Leia.description: a member of the Imperial Senate and a leader of the Rebel Alliance.

Grand Moff Tarkin.description: Governor of the Imperial Outland Regions and commander of the Death Star.

Obi-Wan \"Ben\" Kenobi.description: an aging Jedi Master and former mentor of Darth Vader who introduces Luke to the Force.

Chewbacca.description: A Wookiee who is Han's longtime friend and part of the Rebellion

Darth Vader.description: A powerful Sith lord and the second in command of the Galactic Empire; Luke and Leia's father

Leia Organa.description: The former princess of the destroyed planet Alderaan, who is part of the Rebellion; Luke's twin sister, and Han's love interest

Lando Calrissian.description: The former Baron Administrator of Cloud City and one of Han's friends who aids the Rebellion

Galactic Empire.description: The evil ruler of the Galactic Empire and Darth Vader's powerful Sith Master, who appears via hologram. Clive Revill originally provided his voice, while actress Marjorie Eaton portrayed him physically, wearing a mask.[a] Ultimately the actress and voice actor were replaced by Ian McDiarmid, who portrayed the character in later films, for the 2004 DVD edition and subsequent releases.[16][17][b]

the Emperor.description: The evil founding supreme ruler of the Galactic Empire and Vader's Sith Master

General Leia Organa.description: arrie Fisher as General Leia Organa, twin sister to Luke, former princess of Alderaan, and a leading general in the Resistance.[11]

Kylo Ren.description: dam Driver as Kylo Ren, Supreme Leader Snoke's disciple, who is strong with the Force and leader to the Knights of Ren. He is the son of Han Solo and Leia Organa, nephew of Luke Skywalker, and the grandson of Anakin.[11]

Rey.description: a highly Force-sensitive scavenger from the desert planet Jakku who joined the Resistance and goes to find Luke Skywalker.[11]

Finn.description: a former stormtrooper of the First Order who defected to the Resistance.[11][15]

Poe Dameron.description: a high-ranking X-wing fighter pilot in the Resistance.[11][16]

Maz Kanata.description: a pirate and ally of the Resistance.[11]

Supreme Leader Snoke.description: the leader of the First Order and Kylo Ren's master.[11]

General Hux.description: the former head of the First Order's Starkiller Base.[11]

Lor San Tekka.description: A retired adventurer on Jakku, aiding the Resistance in finding Skywalker.

Captain Phasma.description: the commander of the First Order's stormtroopers.[11][17]

Rose Tico.description: a member of the Resistance who at the beginning works in maintenance.[18][19]
